channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Data centers are booming. But there are big energy and environmental risks
item.description: How tech companies and government officials handle local impacts will shape the industry's future in the U.S.

item.title: Maine Gov. Janet Mills enters crowded Democratic race to unseat Susan Collins
item.description: Mills was reportedly recruited by Democratic Senate leaders after her high-profile confrontation with President Donald Trump in February, in which she...

item.title: A Nobel Prize for explaining when technology leads to growth
item.description: The 2025 Nobel Prize in economics was awarded to Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt.

item.title: In reading, the nation's students are still stuck in a pandemic slump
item.description: New 2025 testing data shows third- through eighth-graders scored far below 2019 levels in reading. In math, some grades have made gains, but all are l...

item.title: Opinion: Why I'm handing in my Pentagon press pass
item.description: Tom Bowman has held his Pentagon press pass for 28 years. He says the Pentagon's new media policy makes it impossible to be a journalist, which means ...

item.title: Maine Gov. Janet Mills kicks off Senate run in critical 2026 race
item.description: The seat, held by Republican Sen. Susan Collins, could be one of only a few realistic Senate pickup opportunities for Democrats next year — but Janet ...

item.title: 14 people killed, with victims showing "signs of torture" in Ecuador
item.description: Four men and four women had "signs of torture" with their hands tied together and "their heads covered in black bags," according to a police report.

item.title: Kenyan officer killed in bow-and-arrow attack at gate of president's residence
item.description: The attack raises questions about security at one of Kenya's most heavily guarded places.

item.title: Rare October storm brings heavy rain and possible mudslides to Southern California
item.description: Some homes have been ordered evacuated in wildfire-scarred Los Angeles neighborhoods as Southern California was hit by a rare October storm that was e...

item.title: Letitia James gets standing ovation at Mamdani rally after indictment
item.description: James spoke at a campaign rally for mayoral frontrunner Zohran Mamdani in her first public appearance since the Justice Department charged her with ba...

item.title: 3 Italian police killed as evicted residents allegedly blow up farmhouse
item.description: Officials in Italy say a house explosion that killed 3 police was a deliberate attack by residents who had previously resisted eviction.

item.title: Venezuela shuts embassy in Norway following opposition leader's Nobel award
item.description: Oslo calls the decision "regrettable", stressing that the Nobel committee functions independently.

item.title: 9/9: CBS Morning News
item.description: House panel releases letter to Jeffrey Epstein allegedly written by President Trump; Hospitality workers find skateboarding to be a release from their...

item.title: US shipping chaos: I fear my wedding sari is destroyed
item.description: Customers worry about missing parcels as shipping companies struggle to handle a flood of packages facing new customs and tariff rules.

item.title: Who are the released hostages?
item.description: The Israeli military says 20 living hostages have been released by Hamas and have returned to Israel.

item.title: Google to invest $15bn to build AI data hub in India
item.description: This is Google’s biggest investment outside the US , the firm's top executive says.

item.title: Authorities name the 16 killed in Tennessee plant blast, with a painstaking investigation promised
Dallas ICE facility shooter feared radiation exposure and practiced shooting, records show
